WorkItem.Description: Saw the update to 2.3.12, rejoiced as I saw the note saying that all items with resilience were being flagged as purchasable PvP items (thus meaning I didn't have to keep a custom edited item d-base anymore that has those items manually removed), and then I cried with sad when I loaded my Death Knight and saw that PvP items were still populating my lists, thus making my already extremely long DPSDK optimize/build upgrade list (hi Bloodysorc!) even longer.
WorkItem.Summary: [Items] Items with Resilience NOT being flagged as Purchasable PvP Item

Comments.Message:
What this means is that there's now a filter where you can select to remove all pvp items.
You need to remove the tick from the 'PVP' item in the filters.
If you've done so and still get pvp items, then something's wrong.
Aye, there's something wrong, thus why I posted this report :)  Doing an Armory refresh on each item is working so far, even for the weapons, which didn't use to work.

You didn't get the full info about what change was made.

The items that *have no other source* will be flagged as 'Purchasable PvP Item' when refreshed from Wowhead. Refresh from Armory won't do it.
